comments.author: steffen.wilberg@web.de
comments.raw_text:
I can imagine sites featuring introductory animations, or react to user actions, where the site content animates somehow into its final size and position. I think skipping to the completed state would make most sense for these cases. An example are the transition effects on github while browsing source trees. On the other hand, such animations would usually have a short duration, so there's less need to interrupt or skip them.

I'm more concerned about cases like this:
"Pulsing is the new blink. You heard it here first."
http://www.webkit.org/blog-files/pulse.html (webkit only obviously)

So just pausing or stopping in-progress animations would be fine.
